info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:48PM EDT until July 24 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN SCHENECTADY...ALBANY...NORTHEASTERN GREENE...EASTERN SCHOHARIE AND SOUTHWESTERN RENSSELAER COUNTIES... At 647 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Altamont to near Berne to near Preston Hollow, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 6:45 PM, a 40 mph wind gust was reported at the mesonet site in Medusa, New York. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Rotterdam, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Nassau, Delmar, Latham, Guilderland, Duanesburg, Menands, New Baltimore, Westerlo, Ravena, Berne and Voorheesville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
